page.title: 11 PARISH CHURCH OF ST. OSWALD
page.content: 1 The church in Rockhampton is surrounded by a graveyard and has a tower at the West end and a nave without aisles. Parts of the church date from the (l3, but most is (l4-(l5. There are traces of medieval paintings on the walls. The vicar is the Rev. Raymond Waterson, incumbent since 1979. He responded to the letter we sent him asking for information. Since the beginning of January '85, he has been obliged to take over the parishes of Oldbury-on-Severn with Shepperdine, in addition to Falfield and Rockhampton, and circumstances being such, he has, since then, needed to spend a dis-proportionate amount of time at Oldbury. His work at Rockhampton had been rather limited this year to conducting the statutary services, visiting the sick, and
